Detailed Description

The first user program - tests the memory allocation routines by allocating and de-allocating random memory blocks.

Definition in file main.c.

00037  /* Reset the information on the blocks */
00038  for(clock=0; clock<16; clock++)

00040   blocks[clock].addr=0;

00042

00044

00047   long          addr;
00048   unsigned int  flags=rnd()&3;
00049 
00050   /* randomize the size of a block. */
00051   blocks[clock].size=(24*1024*1024-total_memory_size)*(rnd()&(256*256-1))/
00052                      (256*256*8);
00053 
00054   /* Sanity check the block size. */
00055   if ((blocks[clock].size>0) && 
00056       (blocks[clock].size<(24*1024*1024)))
00057   {
00058    /* Try to allocate memory. */
00059    addr=alloc(blocks[clock].size,flags);
00060 
00061    /* Check if it was successful. */
00062    if (addr<=0)
00063    {
00064     prints("Memory block allocate failed!\n");
00065     break;
00066    }
00067 
00068    prints(".");
00069 
00070    /* Keep track of how much memory we have allocated... */
00071    total_memory_size+=blocks[clock].size;
00072    /* and the address. */
00073    blocks[clock].addr=addr;
00074   }
00075   else
00076   {
00077    blocks[clock].addr=0;
00078   }
00079 
00080   clock=(clock+1)&15;
00081 
00082   /* Try to free one block. */

00084   {
00085    if (0 != free(blocks[clock].addr))
00086    {
00087     prints("Memory block free failed!\n");
00088     break;
00089    }
